instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP3V43_G3H: What is PP3V43_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V42_G3H When you see PP3V43_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light
threads.message:
Hi Guys, 

I dont have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> on this board.
Can u guys try help me figure out?

Thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light
threads.message:
Do you have 16v coming to the input of the circuit at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?

Is there a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V43_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light
threads.message:
Yes, I have 17v from <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> (replaced)
I check in <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>  a short to ground and i get 17.54k[COLOR=#545454][FONT=arial]Ω[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light
threads.message: Why are you measuring <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, 3V42 comes from <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>.
